meanings.definition: Capable of being propagated or spread
meanings.sent1: The seeds of this plant are propagable, allowing it to grow in various locations.
meanings.sent2: The virus was propagable through close contact with infected individuals.
meanings.sent3: The idea of having a pet rock is propagable, but not very practical.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was propagable, lighting up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The scent of freshly baked cookies is propagable, drawing everyone to the kitchen.

meanings.definition: Able to be transmitted or communicated to others
meanings.sent1: His enthusiasm for the project was propagable, inspiring others to join in.
meanings.sent2: The news of the upcoming event was propagable among the community.
meanings.sent3: The joke he told was propagable, making everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her positive energy was propagable, uplifting those around her.
meanings.sent5: The sense of excitement in the air was propagable, creating a buzz among the crowd.
